channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison urges further downloads of COVIDSafe, global COVID-19 infections climb past 3.1 million as nation's death toll stands at 90

item.description: One writer described the expert's style as 1950's contemporary classic, feminine and pulled-together, which stands out in Washington.
item.title: Dr Deborah Birx's scarves earn her pop culture star status

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The pandemic is also on course to claim more civilian lives in Britain than the Blitz of World War II.
item.title: Britain's official coronavirus death toll tracking even worse than Italy's

item.description: Bill de Blasio oversaw the dispersal of a large, tightly packed Hasidic Jewish funeral and lashed out at the mourners who had gathered in defiance of social distancing rules.
item.title: New York City mayor lashes out at mourners at large Jewish funeral during pandemic

item.description: The 12-year-old girl was allegedly abducted from a Sydney skate park and taken to a home where she was sexually assaulted, police say.
item.title: Man charged over alleged abduction, sexual assault of Sydney schoolgirl

item.description: An experimental drug has proved effective against the new coronavirus in a major study, shortening the time it takes for patients to recover, US government and company officials have announced.
item.title: Gilead drug helps coronavirus patients in US study, raising hopes in pandemic fight

item.description: The drop in the January-March quarter will be only a precursor of a far grimmer report to come on the current April-June period, experts warn.
item.title: US economy shrank 4.8 per cent last quarter, with worst yet to come

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Streets of Rage 4 celebrates the '90s Sega franchise while also adapting the influential visuals, music and gameplay for 2020.
item.title: Iconic brawler hits the streets again after 26 years

item.description: It's no surprise Evel Knievel spent his life with the kind of characters you couldn't make up.
item.title: What's on TV: Tuesday, May 5

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Westpac's $150 million venture capital unit Reinventure says it could explore using external sources of capital for its next fund.
item.title: Westpac's Reinventure mulls bringing in external capital

item.description: Getting into a Zoom call is easy. Then the awkwardness sets in. And, um, how do you get out?
item.title: Signs you've come down with a case of 'Zoomxhaustion'

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The then NSW Sports Minister Stuart Ayres and his office twice intervened in a sports grants program, which saw millions of dollars in funding allocated to Liberal seats ahead of the 2019 state election.
item.title: NSW minister intervened in sports grants program

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 30, 2020

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Players could be forced to take pay cuts as Channel Nine plays hardball with the NRL over how much it is willing to pay in 2020.
item.title: NRL braces for $60m shortfall as broadcasters eye discount

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: Australia's calls for an inquiry into the pandemic have been handled clumsily, warns Australia's first ambassador to Beijing.
item.title: Don't join China COVID-19 'blame game', Gough's man in Beijing warns

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Criminals are cashing in on fear and shortages by selling unsafe vaccines, repurposed antivirals - which are in very short supply on the dark web, finds a study.
item.title: Fake vaccines, antivirals and purported cures for COVID-19 on dark web

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Doubling the dole has kept a portion of the rental market affordable for the unemployed for the first time in 11 years, while economists predict a steep fall in rent.
item.title: Rents falling as dole rises to give low-income households relief

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Hundreds of members are complaining of poor communication from their super funds and delays in receiving payments as two funds process one-third of early access payments.
item.title: 'Endless domino effect': Hostplus, Rest members bemoan delays in super payouts

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Re-use of disposable gowns, masks and goggles will be explored as Australia wrestles with a global shortage of protective equipment.
item.title: Taskforce investigating 'potential future use' of disposable protective equipment

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Former Myer boss Richard Umbers says shoppers likely to steer clear of stores even after the social distancing restrictions are loosened.
item.title: Former Myer boss Richard Umbers predicts more pain ahead for Australian retail

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: While there were no deaths due to cannabis toxicity alone, the report found other drugs or alcohol were also present in most cases.
item.title: Australian study finds vehicle crashes are a common factor in cannabis deaths

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Australia's electricity grid will be able to draw 75 per cent of its supply from renewable energy within just five years, or about triple the present level and much faster than previously predicted.
item.title: Australia's grid could handle a huge leap in renewable power by 2025

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the week ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, April 30

item.dc:creator: Pru Goward
item.description: Even if a vaccine is found, Australians are unlikely to be at the head of the queue to receive it. We need to rethink the barriers to saving lives in a pandemic.
item.title: Australia needs a sporting chance in the COVID-19 vaccine race

item.description: We all want to re-establish access to aged care facilities, but opening them without adequate protections could be lethal.
item.title: Why the PM is wrong to push for visits to nursing homes

item.description: We should acknowledge Captain James Cook’s landing on our shores with respect and compassion for both sides of the debate.
item.title: We must not only say 'sorry', but enact 'sorry' to progress

item.description: A social media trend pushing people to 'improve' themselves during lockdown is unhelpful - and infuriating
item.title: Sanctimonious 'thought leaders' are the laziest of all

item.description: It's been suggested we can simply isolate vulnerable people, but that's not possible when you depend on contact with carers.
item.title: Getting back to 'normal' terrifies me: COVID-19 success could be deadly

item.dc:creator: Kevin Rudd
item.description: Some of Malcolm Turnbull’s recollections are wrong – here are my top five.
item.title: Five ways Malcolm Turnbull's memoir gets it wrong

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: In need of a laugh? Here are five fun, family-friendly games to play while you isolate at home.
item.title: Top five family-friendly games to keep you laughing through isolation

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: With 10,000 steps having been drilled into us as the figure that should be our daily goal, watching our averages fall well below that can be unsettling. But you don't need to be hitting 10,000 steps to stay healthy.
item.title: How many steps you should aim to walk a day during lockdown

item.description: Hours after the first wireless call between Australia and Great Britain, editors at The Sydney Morning Herald and London's Morning Post held their own conversation.
item.title: From the Archives, 1930: Newspaper editors converse via wireless telephone

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: We'd love to see the PM's reaction when he finds out who's in line to become Anna Bligh's chief lieutenant, replacing former Coalition staffer Nathalie Samia.
item.title: Wouldn't bank on Morrison loving ABA appointment

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Testing for coronavirus at schools would help reveal the true infection rate in the community and protect staff from the disease, experts say.
item.title: Government faces calls for coronavirus testing in schools

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Principals at many non-government schools have rejected the Morrison government’s cash inducement to reopen classrooms, even though their revenue has been hit.
item.title: Principals reject cash lure to resume classes, despite financial pain

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The fight for finance has meant research-intensive startups are now borrowing against predicted offsets.
item.title: Startups turn to R&D rebate loans to counter capital crunch

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: But the government will leave open the possibility of a new train station at Pyrmont for Sydney's new Metro West rail line.
item.title: Western Sydney site ditched as train station for $20b metro rail line

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Evidence is emerging that suggests flipping some coronavirus patients on their front could save lives.
item.title: Hospital teams coached in life-saving 'swimmer's pose'

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Similar to physical scarring, the traumatic experience of losing a job can leave a worker with mental, financial and social scarring for decades.
item.title: True scars of our war against COVID-19 are yet to reveal themselves

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: Students in states that return to classroom teaching sooner will have an advantage over those in other states doing online learning, experts warn.
item.title: Students doing online learning will fall behind peers in other states

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Court is sitting from 2pm to accommodate the state's final fibres witness, Dr Ray Palmer, who will give evidence via video link from the UK due to coronavirus travel restrictions.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: 'Very little regard': Fibre expert slams forensic handling of victims' bodies

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: COVID-19 cases in the US surpass 1 million, University of Queensland vaccine shows promise as Australian death toll stands at 90

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, April 30

item.description: At least 36 people have been killed when one of South Korea's worst fires in years broke out at a construction site near the capital, officials say.
item.title: South Korean building site fire kills at least 36 people

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The nation's Deputy Chief Medical officer Paul Kelly is confident Australia can handle a second wave of infections if there is a sudden spike when the country winds back restrictions.
item.title: Nation can handle second infection wave, says deputy medical chief

item.description: While scouting the demographic provides mixed results.
item.title: No time to be welshing on words

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As it happened: National death toll hits 90; Yarraville childcare centre closes; Sunshine hospital workers sent home

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Inflation figures show hoarders were forced to pay extra for their loo paper and hand sanitiser, amid warnings of a huge hit to the economy.
item.title: Coronavirus tax: Cost of living goes up as economy braces for $130b hit
